meanings.definition: The action of treating something sacred with disrespect or irreverence.
meanings.sent1: The profanation of the temple shocked the community.
meanings.sent2: The profanation of the church was met with outrage.
meanings.sent3: The profanation of the sacred ground was like a slap in the face to tradition.
meanings.sent4: Her words felt like a profanation of everything he held dear.
meanings.sent5: The profanation of the ceremony left a bitter taste in everyone's mouth.

meanings.definition: The act of desecrating or defiling something holy or sacred.
meanings.sent1: The profanation of the ancient artifact was a crime against history.
meanings.sent2: The profanation of the shrine was a sacrilegious act.
meanings.sent3: The profanation of the sacred text was like scribbling on a masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The profanation of their vows felt like a betrayal of trust.
meanings.sent5: The profanation of the ritual site left a stain on their conscience.
